fr.sorbonne_u.components.reflection.connectors

Class ReflectionConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.reflection.connectors.ReflectionConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectorI, ComponentServiceI, OfferedI, RequiredI, IntercessionI, IntrospectionI, ReflectionI, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ReflectionConnector
extends AbstractConnector
implements ReflectionI
    The class ReflectionConnector defines the connector associated the interface ReflectionI.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2016-02-25

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • hasSerialisedExecution

        public boolean hasSerialisedExecution()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: IntrospectionI
        return true if the component guarantees a serialised execution of its services.

        In the baseline definition, this returns true if the component has its own threads and if the total number of threads is exactly one. A component can guarantee its serialised execution in other ways and then should redefine the method for example, by making all externally callable services implemented by synchronised methods.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        hasSerialisedExecution in interface IntrospectionI
        Returns:
        true if the component guarantees a serialised execution of its services.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
        See Also:
        IntrospectionI.hasSerialisedExecution()
